info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:02PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mississippi, southwestern Dyer and northwestern Lauderdale Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 702 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ashport, or 10 miles east of Luxora, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ashport, Barr, Hickman, Porter Gap, Edith, Barfield, O`Donnell Bend, Tomato, Rosa, Luckett, Three Point, Armorel, Huffman, Stinger, Lightfoot, Tiger Tail, Arp, Chic and Chickasaw National Wildlife Refuge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
